query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 «Chi è costui che ’l nostro monte cerchia 2 prima che morte li abbia dato il volo, 3 e apre li occhi a sua voglia e coverchia?».
query.error: **English:** 1 "Who is this who circles our mountain 2 before death has given him flight, 3 and opens and closes his eyes at will?"
query.result: 1 "Kaḥ ayam yaḥ parvatam asmākam paryāvartate 2 pūrvam mṛtyunā tasmai dattam gamanam, 3 svacchandena ca nayana-dvāram vivṛṇoti samvṛṇoti ca?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 «Non so chi sia, ma so ch’e’ non è solo; 5 domandal tu che più li t’avvicini, 6 e dolcemente, sì che parli, acco’lo».
query.error: **English:** 4 "I do not know who he is, but I know that he is not alone; 5 ask him yourself, you who are closer to him, 6 and speak to him gently, so that he may answer you."
**English:** 7 Thus two spirits, bowed down to each other, 8 were speaking of me there on my right; 9 then they lifted their faces to speak to me,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 e disse l’uno: «O anima che fitta 11 nel corpo ancora inver’ lo ciel ten vai, 12 per carità ne consola e ne ditta
query.error: **English:** 10 and one said: "O soul, still bound to the body, 11 who goest toward heaven, have pity on us 12 and tell us whence thou comest and who thou art,
query.result: 10 tataḥ ekaḥ uvāca: "He jīva ātmā, adyāpi śarīre sthitaḥ svargam prati gacchasi, 11 anukampām kuru asmākam ca asmābhiḥ saha kathāṃ kuru, 12 kutaḥ āgacchasi kaś ca asi; yataḥ tava āgamanaṃ asmān atiśayam āścaryayati,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 onde vieni e chi se’; ché tu ne fai 14 tanto maravigliar de la tua grazia, 15 quanto vuol cosa che non fu più mai».
query.error: **English:** 13 whence comest thou and who art thou'; for thou makest us 14 so greatly to marvel at thy grace, 15 as a thing that never was before».
query.result: 13 kutaḥ āgacchasi kaś ca asi'; yaḥ tvam asmān 14 tvat-prasādena atiśayam āścaryayasi, 15 yathā vastv ekam yaḥ na abhūt pūrvam kadācit».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 E io: «Per mezza Toscana si spazia 17 un fiumicel che nasce in Falterona, 18 e cento miglia di corso nol sazia.
query.error: **English:** 16 And I: "Through half of Tuscany it spreads, 17 a little stream that springs in Falterona, 18 and a course of a hundred miles does not satisfy it.
query.result: 16 Aham ca: "Ardhaṃ Tuṣārakṣetrasya vistṛtaṃ bhavati 17 ekā nadikā yā Falteronāyām utpadyate, 18 śatayojanāni ca pravahaṇena tṛpyati na."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Di sovr’ esso rech’ io questa persona: 20 dirvi ch’i’ sia, saria parlare indarno, 21 ché ’l nome mio ancor molto non suona».
query.error: **English:** 19 Concerning him, I asked who this person was: 20 to say who I am would be to speak in vain, 21 for my name is not yet widely known.
query.result: 19 Asya viṣaye aham apṛcchāmi ayam kaḥ puruṣaḥ: 20 Yadi aham vakṣyāmi kaḥ aham asmi, tadā nirarthakam bhaviṣyati, 21 Yataḥ mama nāma adyāpi bahu na śrūyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 «Se ben lo ’ntendimento tuo accarno 23 con lo ’ntelletto», allora mi rispuose 24 quei che diceva pria, «tu parli d’Arno».
query.error: **English:** 22 "If your understanding is well-fleshed out 23 with intellect," then he who spoke before replied to me, 24 "you speak of the Arno."
query.result: 22 "Yadi tava buddhiḥ samyak 23 prajñayā saha," atha mama pratyavādat 24 saḥ yaḥ pūrvaṃ bruvāṇa āsīt, "tvam Arnoḥ kathāṃ kuruṣe."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 E l’altro disse lui: «Perché nascose 26 questi il vocabol di quella riviera, 27 pur com’ om fa de l’orribili cose?».
query.error: **English:** 25 And the other said to him: "Why did 26 this one conceal the name of that river, 27 just as one does with horrible things?".
query.result: 25 Aparaśca tasmai uvāca: "Kimartham ayam 26 Asya nadīyāḥ śabdam apihitavān, 27 Yathā kaścid ghorāṇi vastūni karoti?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 vertù così per nimica si fuga 38 da tutti come biscia, o per sventura 39 del luogo, o per mal uso che li fruga:

query.result: 37 śaktir evam apakṛṣṭayā dūreṇaiva parityaktaḥ 38 sarvebhyaḥ sarpa iva, vā asya sthānasya durdaivāt, 39 vā asya sthānasya durvyavahārāt yaḥ tāṃ pidayati:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 ond’ hanno sì mutata lor natura 41 li abitator de la misera valle, 42 che par che Circe li avesse in pastura.
query.error: **English:** 40 whence the inhabitants of the wretched valley 41 have so changed their nature, 42 that it seems as if Circe had them in her pasture.
query.result: 40 yataḥ tathā parivṛttā svabhāvaḥ teṣām 41 asya duḥkhitasya upatyakāyāḥ nivāsinaḥ, 42 yathā pratibhāti yathā Circe tāṃ paśupālane dadāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Tra brutti porci, più degni di galle 44 che d’altro cibo fatto in uman uso, 45 dirizza prima il suo povero calle.
query.error: **English:** 43 Among vile hogs, more worthy of acorns 44 than other food made for human use, 45 he first directs his wretched path.
query.result: 43 Durācāraśūkarenaiva yogyān 44 anyānnānānmānuṣānāṃ prayogāt, 45 ātmīyamārgaṃ prathamamārabhate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Botoli trova poi, venendo giuso, 47 ringhiosi più che non chiede lor possa, 48 e da lor disdegnosa torce il muso.
query.error: **English:** 46 He then finds toads, coming down, 47 snarling more than their power allows them, 48 and from them he disdainfully turns away his snout.
query.result: 46 Tataḥ adhastanaṃ prāpya bhekān paśyati, 47 te ca svayam-śakty-atiriktam garjanti, 48 tebhyaś ca sa jijñāsayā vaktram vikurute.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Vassi caggendo; e quant’ ella più ’ngrossa, 50 tanto più trova di can farsi lupi 51 la maladetta e sventurata fossa.
query.error: **English:** 49 They fall down, and as they fall, the more they grow, 50 so much the more the accursed and ill-starred ditch 51 finds of them to make itself wolves.
query.result: 49 Patanti cadantaśca; yāvatī ca sāpi vardhate, 50 tāvatīṃs tām adhikaṃ paśyati śṛgālāṃ kartum 51 śaptā ca durdaivā ca parikhā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Discesa poi per più pelaghi cupi, 53 trova le volpi sì piene di froda, 54 che non temono ingegno che le occùpi.
query.error: **English:** 52 Then, descending through deeper seas, 53 he finds the foxes so full of fraud, 54 that they fear no cunning that may entrap them.
query.result: 52 Tataḥ adhobhāge gambhīratarān samudrān avatīrṇaḥ, 53 vṛkān paśyati chalaṃ prapañcaṃ kurvatas, 54 ye na bibhyati kautukāt, yaḥ pratīyati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 Né lascerò di dir perch’ altri m’oda; 56 e buon sarà costui, s’ancor s’ammenta 57 di ciò che vero spirto mi disnoda.
query.error: **English:** 55 Nor will I fail to tell it, so that others may hear me; 56 and it will be good for him, if he still remembers 57 what a true spirit reveals to me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Io veggio tuo nepote che diventa 59 cacciator di quei lupi in su la riva 60 del fiero fiume, e tutti li sgomenta.
query.error: **English:** 58 I see your grandson, who becomes 59 a hunter of those wolves on the bank 60 of the fierce river, and scatters them all.
query.result: 58 Paśyāmi tava pautram yaḥ bhavati 59 mṛgayākaraḥ teṣām vṛkānām upare 60 ugrasyā nadyaḥ, sarvāṃś ca tāṃś chālayati.

Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Sanguinoso esce de la trista selva; 65 lasciala tal, che di qui a mille anni 66 ne lo stato primaio non si rinselva».

query.result: 70 Tathā aparaṃ puruṣaṃ apaśyam yaḥ parāvṛttaḥ 71 śravaṇe vartate, vikalpyate ca duḥkhī ca bhavati, 72 yadā sa vacanaṃ svayam eva samākarṇayat.

Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 per che lo spirto che di pria parlòmi 77 ricominciò: «Tu vuo’ ch’io mi deduca 78 nel fare a te ciò che tu far non vuo’mi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Ma da che Dio in te vuol che traluca 80 tanto sua grazia, non ti sarò scarso; 81 però sappi ch’io fui Guido del Duca.
query.error: **English:** 79 But since God wills that His grace shine so much in you, 80 I will not be stingy with you; 81 therefore, know that I was Guido del Duca.
query.result: 79 Api tu yasmāt parameśvaraḥ tvayi 80 Tathā svakṛpāṃ prakāśayitumicchati, 81 Ata eva jānīhi yad aham āsmi Guido del Duca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 Fu il sangue mio d’invidia sì rïarso, 83 che se veduto avesse uom farsi lieto, 84 visto m’avresti di livore sparso.
query.error: **English:** 82 My blood was so inflamed with envy, 83 that if I had seen a man made happy, 84 you would have seen me drenched in lividness.
query.result: 82 Mama raktaḥ īrṣyāyāḥ tathā prajvalitaḥ āsīt, 83 Yadi kaścid dṛṣṭaḥ syāt naraḥ santuṣṭaḥ, 84 Mamam dṛṣṭavān asi lividena āvṛtam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Di mia semente cotal paglia mieto; 86 o gente umana, perché poni ’l core 87 là ’v’ è mestier di consorte divieto?
query.error: **English:** 85 Such straw I reap from my own seed; 86 O human race, why do you set your heart 87 where a companion is forbidden?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 Questi è Rinier; questi è ’l pregio e l’onore 89 de la casa da Calboli, ove nullo 90 fatto s’è reda poi del suo valore.
query.error: **English:** 88 This is Rinier; this is the glory and the honor 89 of the house of Calboli, where no one 90 has since been heir to his valor.
query.result: 88 Ayaṃ Rinieraḥ; ayaṃ eva yaśaḥ eva ca 89 Calboli-gṛhasya, yatra na kaścit 90 tataḥ param tasya śauryaṃ prāptaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.result: 91 Na ca tasya raktaṃ kevalameva kṣīṇamasti, 92 Po-nadyāḥ parvatasya samudrasya Reṇaḥ-nadyāśca madhye, 93 satyena sukhena ca sampūrṇāt śubhāt,

Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 ché dentro a questi termini è ripieno 95 di venenosi sterpi, sì che tardi 96 per coltivare omai verrebber meno.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Ov’ è ’l buon Lizio e Arrigo Mainardi? 98 Pier Traversaro e Guido di Carpigna? 99 Oh Romagnuoli tornati in bastardi!
query.error: **English:** 97 Where is the good Lizio and Arrigo Mainardi? 98 Pier Traversaro and Guido di Carpigna? 99 Oh Romagnuols, returned to bastards!
query.result: 97 Kutra asti śubhaḥ Lizioḥ Arrigaśca Mainardiḥ? 98 Pieraḥ Traversaraḥ Guido vā Carpiṇyāḥ? 99 Aha Romaṇyās tiryaggatayaḥ pratyāgatāḥ!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Quando in Bologna un Fabbro si ralligna? 101 quando in Faenza un Bernardin di Fosco, 102 verga gentil di picciola gramigna?
query.error: **English:** 100 When in Bologna did a Fabbro rise again? 101 When in Faenza a Bernardin di Fosco, 102 a noble scion of a petty stock?
query.result: 100 Kadā Bolonyāyāṁ ko ’pi karmakāraḥ punar jātaḥ? 101 Kadā Faenzāyāṁ ko ’pi Bernardinaḥ Foskaḥ, 102 kṣudra-tṛṇasya mṛduḥ śākhā?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Non ti maravigliar s’io piango, Tosco, 104 quando rimembro, con Guido da Prata, 105 Ugolin d’Azzo che vivette nosco,
query.error: **English:** 103 Do not wonder if I weep, Tuscan, 104 when I recall, with Guido da Prata, 105 Ugolino d'Azzo who lived with us,
query.result: 103 Mā viṣmayaḥ, yadi aham rodamasmi, Tuṣāra, 104 yadā smaramyaham, Guideṇa Prata-nivāsinā saha, 105 Ugolīnam Azzonaḥ, yaḥ asmābhiḥ saha jīvitaḥ,

106 Federigo Tignoso e sua brigata, 107 la casa Traversara e li Anastagi 108 (e l’una gente e l’altra è diretata),

query.result: 106 Federicum Tignosum tasya ca gaṇam, 107 gṛham Traversara-nāmakam Anastāgīnām ca 108 (ubhe ca kule nirūḍhe),

109 le donne e ’ cavalier, li affanni e li agi 110 che ne ’nvogliava amore e cortesia 111 là dove i cuor son fatti sì malvagi.
query.error: **English:** 109 the ladies and the knights, the hardships and the comforts 110 that love and courtesy inspired in us 111 there where hearts have become so wicked.
query.result: 109 strī-puruṣān, kleśān sukham ca 110 yeṣu asmān preraṇayati sma premaḥ śiṣṭācāraśca 111 tatra yatra hṛdayāni evam duritāni jāni.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 O Bretinoro, ché non fuggi via, 113 poi che gita se n’è la tua famiglia 114 e molta gente per non esser ria?
query.error: **English:** 112 O Bretinoro, why do you not flee, 113 since your family has departed 114 and many people in order not to be wicked?
query.result: 112 He Bretinoro, kimartham na palāyasi, 113 yasmāt tava kulam gatam asti, 114 aneke ca janāḥ pāpabhītās?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Ben fa Bagnacaval, che non rifiglia; 116 e mal fa Castrocaro, e peggio Conio, 117 che di figliar tai conti più s’impiglia.
query.error: **English:** 115 Bagnacavallo does well, that it does not rebuild; 116 and Castrocaro does badly, and worse Conio, 117 that entangles itself more in begetting such counts.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Ben faranno i Pagan, da che ’l demonio 119 lor sen girà; ma non però che puro 120 già mai rimagna d’essi testimonio.
query.error: **English:** 118 The Pagans will do well, since the devil 119 goes around them; but not so that pure 120 testimony of them ever remains.
query.result: 118 Yathāvat kuryuḥ pāganāḥ, yataḥ teṣāṃ 119 asuraḥ paribhramaṇam karoti; na tu tataḥ 120 kadācit teṣāṃ śuddham pratyakṣam avatiṣṭhate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 O Ugolin de’ Fantolin, sicuro 122 è ’l nome tuo, da che più non s’aspetta 123 chi far lo possa, tralignando, scuro.
query.error: **English:** 121 O Ugolino de’ Fantolin, your name is secure, 122 since no one is expected to do it anymore, 123 who could do it, degenerating, obscurely.
query.result: 121 He Ugolīna de Fantolīna, niścitam 122 tava nāma, yataḥ adhunā na pratikṣyate 123 yaḥ kartaṃ śaknuyeta, vikṛtaḥ, agamyena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Ma va via, Tosco, omai; ch’or mi diletta 125 troppo di pianger più che di parlare, 126 sì m’ha nostra ragion la mente stretta».
query.error: **English:** 124 But go now, Tuscan, for now it pleases me 125 more to weep than to speak, 126 so tightly has our discussion constricted my mind.
query.result: 124 Api tu gaccha, Tuṣkāra, adhunā; yataḥ adya mama priyam asti 125 adhikam roditum api tu kathayitum, 126 evam mama yuktiḥ manaḥ samkocitaṃ kṛtavān.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Noi sapavam che quell’ anime care 128 ci sentivano andar; però, tacendo, 129 facëan noi del cammin confidare.
query.error: **English:** 127 We knew that those dear souls 128 heard us walking; however, remaining silent, 129 they made us confident of the journey.
query.result: 127 Vayam vijñāpayāmaḥ yataḥ tāḥ prāṇāḥ priyāḥ 128 Aśṛṇvan naḥ gacchataḥ; tathāpi, maunaṃ kurvantaḥ, 129 Akurvan naḥ mārgasya viśvāsam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Poi fummo fatti soli procedendo, 131 folgore parve quando l’aere fende, 132 voce che giunse di contra dicendo:
query.error: **English:** 130 Then we were left alone, proceeding, 131 like a thunderbolt when it splits the air, 132 a voice came from the opposite direction, saying:
query.result: 130 Tataḥ svakeṣṭamārgamākramya svairaṃ praviṣṭau, 131 vidyullatāvatāra iva nabhaḥsphoṭane, 132 viparītadikpravṛttā vāṇī śruyate sma:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 ‘Anciderammi qualunque m’apprende’; 134 e fuggì come tuon che si dilegua, 135 se sùbito la nuvola scoscende.
query.error: **English:** 133 "Whoever seizes me will kill me"; 134 and he fled like thunder that disperses, 135 if suddenly the cloud bursts.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 Come da lei l’udir nostro ebbe triegua, 137 ed ecco l’altra con sì gran fracasso, 138 che somigliò tonar che tosto segua:
query.error: **English:** 136 As our hearing had a respite from her, 137 behold, the other with such great clamor, 138 that it resembled thunder which quickly follows:
query.result: 136 Yathā asmāt tasyāḥ śravaṇam viśrāntaṃ babhūva, 137 tataḥ eṣā aparā ittham mahānādena, 138 yathā sadṛśaḥ abhavat tadit ghoṣaḥ yaḥ śīghram anveti:

query.prompt:

139 «Io sono Aglauro che divenni sasso»; 140 e allor, per ristrignermi al poeta, 141 in destro feci, e non innanzi, il passo.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 Già era l’aura d’ogne parte queta; 143 ed el mi disse: «Quel fu ’l duro camo 144 che dovria l’uom tener dentro a sua meta.
query.error: **English:** 142 Now the air was still on every side; 143 and he said to me: "That was the hard struggle 144 that should keep man within his boundary.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
145 Ma voi prendete l’esca, sì che l’amo 146 de l’antico avversaro a sé vi tira; 147 e però poco val freno o richiamo.
query.error: **English:** 145 But you take the bait, so that the hook 146 of the ancient adversary draws you to itself; 147 and therefore bridle or recall avails little.

Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.error: **English:** 148 He calls to you from heaven and circles around you, 149 showing you his eternal beauties, 150 and your eye looks only at the ground;

151 onde vi batte chi tutto discerne».
query.error: **English:** 151 therefore he beats you who discerns all things.
query.result: 151 atas tvām sa praharati yaḥ sarvam paśyati.
